intro: Tetracera maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's tetracera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
